caption: It was a challenge to appreciate much of this gorgeous private mansion with the crush of people and the rushed lines!  It is a beautiful mansion, Hotel Particular, so decadently renovated.  I enjoyed this the most!  More than the art, more than the treasures on display, more than the restaurant.  Perhaps I will try again‚Ä¶first thing in the morning.  One this is for sure - buy a timed ticket!

Great place with elegant architecture and amazing art. It was a glimpse into the life of the aristocratic life style. Highly recommended if you want to slightly get away from busiest tourist attractions.
History of my ancestors living at this time in Paris was affirming for me. Can get crowded but worth a trip inside!
Beautiful mansion, gorgeous small (eg manageable in a quick trip) collection, and great tea room. Highly recommend!

Went to see the Borghese exhibit which in and of itself was great, including a number of master pieces on display. The issue is not the quality of the exhibit but more the people management. It was nearly impossible to get close enough to see some of the works because of the number of people in each room. Very difficult to even move around. Overall was not an enjoyable experience by any means.

Very grand historic house with many richly decorated rooms and some very notable paintings - including a couple by Rembrandt and Van Dyck. Also a number of very impressive 18th c tapestries. Bellini exhibition was very good and I enjoyed the main house even more.

Absolutely beautiful hotel and museum, especially the Borghese special exposition. However, the security guard was unbelievably rude and condescending for absolutely no reason. I had a ticket scheduled for 10am in my Apple Wallet: he first didn't seem to believe me and said my ticket was for 17h (?), then made me show him it via email while taunting me and questioning its validity - and I speak french! Perhaps he just wanted to be rude to somebody and chose me since I was alone and the only young person going to the exposition at that time, but it is really mind-boggling to see. Funny thing is he only calmed down when I calmly said that he wasn't being very gentle! Sad that this seems to be the away it works in France sometimes, got to be rude back so they don't overpower you.

You must book your tickets online! I arrived without a ticket and waited 40 mins to purchase one and enter the museum. Don‚Äôt make my mistake.  Really charming museum, filled with art. They especially loved Italian art from the renaissance. I spent 2.5 hours here. There was a lovely Botticelli temp exhibition at the time too.  It‚Äôs nice that they have plenty of benches for people to rest and admire the art in the rooms.

Beautiful place and home to Jacquemart and exquisite collection across the globe on display. Lot of travel stories with the unique pieces.. A beautiful pastry cafe is inside and it‚Äôs interior is amazing. There was an excellent exhibit for Gallen Kallela too which ended on 25th July.

Went to see the Borghese exhibit yesterday and it was our first visit to this museum. We visited the Borghese about 10 years ago and we were excited to once again see some of these masterpieces. The various rooms are small and with the amount of tickets they put on sale took away from the overall experience. One Caravaggio, two Raphael's, a Botticelli, couple of Titians and a Davinci. Did not really recognize the other artists.

I came here to see the Caravaggio exhibit, but was shocked to find such a stunning and well preserved mansion. The art is amazing to see, but for me the real gem was the architecture. And the perfectly preserved furniture. It was a glimpse into the life of the aristocratic life style. By tickets ahead of time though. I waited like 90 min in the cold to get in

If you have a few hours to spare in Paris then Mus√©e Jacquemart-Andr√© is an excellent choice whilst it could be a rainy day activity, there is also a nice inner garden where you can enjoy the sun and the tranquility of a century passed. It's a private museum with an excellent art collection which will take you through how they lived during 19th century and their collections. There is normally also an external exhibition included in the entry. There is also a nice caf√© and restaurant.

Really nice museum! Impressive small palace with spacious rooms and interesting art, very well conserved! Some Rembrandt's and a Van Dyck too. Interesting architecture with opened ceilings and a winter garden! Alana temporary collection was just ok...
Wonderful collection of a Parisian couple. Fantastic venue with a very good audioguide. I have been to Paris many many times and this is my first visit to this museum.  I loved it!
Fabulous mansion preserved as it was back in the day. Great art and design.

Claustrophobics this is not for you! Beautiful wonderful art pieces in tiny, hot dark rooms with far too many people to even begin to appreciate the paintings or get a proper view of them.  People listening to the audio visit (which to be fair must be very interesting) seem to stay a long time in front of each painting causing a considerable build up of people.  Also the tv is impossible to hear if people are having a conversation near by which is a shame.

We went here for the Caravage exhibition, and though paintings were great, we were more impressed by the building itself! What an amazing place (one would say palace), looks like a tiny Versailles within Paris : rooms are full of gilded furnitures, huge velvet curtains, marble stairs, painted roof... and from the outside you would not expect it (we didn't) !
I enjoyed this museum very much. Incredibly beautiful house, art, furniture and architecture. The Fussli exhibit was excellent too.

Incredibly beautiful - reminds me a bit of the Frick in NYC as it's also a former home and all the art was once part of a private collection (!!). Every room is just stunning, and it's small by museum standards so you can see everything in 90 minutes without rushing. It also has a very good cafe - randomly had one of my favorite meals there last visit.

The most beautiful place to visit and enjoy the tremendous collection of Florentine and Venetian art. The winter garden was one of the first of its time. Perfect little tea room to enjoy afterwards. Hidden gem üíé ‚Ä¶

Awesome brunch , cost is around 30 euro for the complete. Get here early as on Sunday it fills fast. Had Cured Ham, Egg, salad, hot chocolate,  and dessert and orange juice and many different bread types. You will be full and ready to see Paris. Enjoy

A fabulous small Museum. Reasonably priced. Without the audio tour, plan on less than an hour. Amazing to see a family mansion preserved. Amazing details from the old wood floors to the ornately painted ceilings.

Exceptional place with a lot of interesting details.  The interior and the permanent collection are impressive.  However,  the exhibition of the Galeria de Borghese takes 8 rooms, and they are always full of people.  It was not possible to enjoy the spirits of the masterpieces.

You buy tickets online and get in the line on time ; and still, 30 min to wait outside in the street without any protection. What‚Äôs the point of selling timed tickets if you wait more than random people without tickets! Also, they don‚Äôt answer to emails.

SEP 2024 Bringing part of the Villa Borghese collection to Parisian audience is a commendable idea, but cramming it into inadequate space is not a good one. Guess commercial interests won over consumers‚Äô hopes. Book in advance, but expect to queue anyway.

This museum is pretty wonderful, but you should absolutely buy tickets in advance and make sure you chose a time slot. There is a line for stand by that can take up to or over an hour, and the ‚Äúticket‚Äù line is for people with tickets AND a time slot, not just day tickets. The collection is lovely, and the house itself is magnificent. The interior stairs and the courtyard out front look like they are straight out of Bridgerton. It‚Äôs also pretty reasonably priced, and has nice traveling exhibits. The location is somewhat off the beaten path, but great for a somewhat different experience in Paris.

This Museum is to my opinion the most fascinating Museum of Paris, the permanent collection is stunning and includes some masterpieces such an amazing Rembrandt, the rooms are enchanting and the schedule of shows always offers something special and interesting. Hammersh√∏i show was totally gorgeous. Is a must visit possibly on a regular basis!
Fantastic museum. The exhibition of F√ºssli was a bit packed. But the collection ( especially the Italian paintings) is extraordinary.

I have been deceived by the service. The food was correct and I may say tasty  even if I remember something better  .... so we needed some bread. We have waited a long while. We asked for the 3d times the hostess and she told us it wasn‚Äôt her work to bring bread while our eggs were getting cold. We had to go and find the breads on a table by oursebelves. The waiter has forgotten our drinking‚Äôs. I had understood why we had so quickly place to sit while before you had to queue a long moment . It is full of tourists but connaisseurs have left . Could do better I think
Great place for a half day tour. The special exhibition on Botticelli was wonderful. It was quite crowded but well organized. Nice work!!

Absolutely beautiful museum to visit. The house itself is grand and detailed. As well, the gallen kallela exhibit was one of the most beautiful that I have seen in the city. The artwork was lovely and there was an informative video as well that gave good context. When I went during the week it was not too busy so it was a nice, quiet visit.

Great place with elegant architecture with quite selection of pre-revolutionary arts of noble families. When I visited there was Giovani Bellini exhibition which was amazing.  Highly recommended if you want to slightly get away from busiest tourist attractions.
Lesser known museum that seemed really popular with locals: Tiepolo staircase was a must-see and the rest of the place was worth breezing through!
wonderful museum and Cafe. The staff was great when we suddenly added a person for lunch. They were very understanding and did a great job accommodating us.
Excellent- gorgeous! No words to describe. Better than Versailles because of the crowds üôàüôà. Stay for lunch inside. Radiant! ‚Ä¶
A wonderful museum, Botticelli's exhibition is really fantastic. An added bonus - incredible desserts in the museum's restaurants

The exhibition 'Hammersh√∏i, the Master of Danish Painting' is the first retrospective devoted to his oeuvre in France for more than twenty years. It brings together more forty major works thanks to exceptional loans from The Ambassador John I n Loeb Jr Danish Art Collection and major European museums, such as the Statens Museum for Kunst and the Hirschsprungske Samling in Copenhagen, The Nationalmuseum and the Thielska Galleriet in Stockholm, the Malm√≥ Konstmuseum, and the Mus√©e d'Orsay and the Tate in London. This exhibition sheds new light on Hammersh√∏i's oeuvre, by showing his links with the artists in his circle. His works are presented for the first time alongside paintings by his brother Svend Hammersh√∏i, his brother-in-law Peter llsted, and his friend Carl Holsoe. This comparative overview shows their artistic affinities and their different styles, while highligh- ting Vilhelm Hammersh√∏i's unique genius.
A private art museum owned by Institute de France. The collection was created by Edouard Andr√© and his wife N√©lie Jacquemard, a well-known society painter.
